New Records: Myles Turner scored a season-high 30 points and grabbed 11 rebounds, surpassing 8,000 career points.
Tyrese Haliburton recorded a season-best 25 points and 12 assists.
Key Match Events: Haliburton hit a pull-up 17-footer with 50 seconds left to extend Indiana's lead.
With the score tied at 116-116, Andrew Nembhard made a finger-roll basket to put Indiana ahead. Dallas missed several key shots in the final minutes.
Pre-Game Insights: The Pacers played without power forward Isaiah Jackson, who suffered a torn right Achilles tendon and is out for the season.
Dereck Lively II was out with a sprained shoulder, and Maxi Kleber missed his fifth consecutive game due to a hamstring injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pacers finished 13 of 32 from the arc, despite entering the game averaging 11.5 made three-pointers.
Luka Doncic was 4 of 10 from downtown, shooting 32.3% from the arc after a career-best 38.2% last season.
